text: Lucius Cornelius Lentulus Lupus (died 125 BC) served as a Roman consul in 156 BC alongside his colleague Gaius Marcius Figulus. Lupus was a member of the Lentuli branch of the gens Cornelia, an elite patrician family. The Latin author Lucilius criticizes Lupus for a decadent and corrupt lifestyle. Lupus was a member of the priestly college decemviri sacris faciundis.Karl-Ludwig Elvers: Cornelius I 51. In: Der Neue Pauly (DNP). Band 3, Metzler, Stuttgart 1997, , Sp. 175. He was charged with extortion,Valerius Maximus 5.9.10 yet still became censor in 147 BC. From 131 to 125 BC he was the princeps senatus. ==References== Category:Roman Republican consuls Lupus, Lucius Category:2nd- century BC Romans Category:Roman patricians Category:125 BC deaths Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Lucius Cornelius Lentulus Lupus (consul 156 BC)
